page.title: 16Crowdy Mill
page.content:
Crowdy Mill is just outside the village of Harbertonford. Our class visited it earlier this term.
The mill has been restored by the {Dartington Trust,}and is now fully operational. Wheat is milled here to make flour. The flour is sold in the health shop at Totnes.
When we went there there was a shortage of water so we didn't actually see it working. The mill stones are powered by a{water-wheel.
Water is extracted from the River Harbourne and carried to the mill in a leat. After it has turned the wheel the water is returned to the river.
It was very interesting.
